Get camera operation matrix

Source: R/get_cam_op.R
get_cam_op.Rd

This function returns the camera operation matrix as returned by camtrapR's function cameraOperation().

get_cam_op(datapkg, ...)

Arguments

datapkg

a camera trap data package object, as returned by read_camtrap_dp(), i.e. a list containing three data.frames:

  1. observations

  2. deployments

  3. multimedia

and a list with metadata: datapackage
...

filter predicates for filtering on deployments

Value

a matrix. Row names always indicate the location_name (station ID) "Station"+location_name. Column names are dates.

Details

The deployment data are grouped by location_name (station ID in camtrapR jargon). If multiple deploymnts are linked to same location, daily efforts higher than one occur.

Examples

get_cam_op(camtrapdp)

#> Note: method with signature ‘Duration#ANY’ chosen for function ‘-’,
#>  target signature ‘Duration#Duration’.
#>  "ANY#Duration" would also be valid
#>                                    2020-06-03 2020-06-04 2020-06-05 2020-06-06
#> StationB_ML_val 03_De Val           0.1533565          1          1          1
#> StationB_ML_val 05_molenkreek       0.1595139          1          1          1

# applying filter(s) on deployments, e.g. deployments with latitude >= 51.28
get_cam_op(camtrapdp, pred_gte("latitude", 51.28))

#> df %>% filter((latitude >= 51.28))
#>                               2020-06-03 2020-06-04 2020-06-05 2020-06-06
#> StationB_ML_val 05_molenkreek  0.1595139          1          1          1
#>                               2020-06-07 2020-06-08 2020-06-09 2020-06-10
#> StationB_ML_val 05_molenkreek          1          1          1          1
